website_summaries.verdict: The best electric metal shear with a powerful electric motor and cutting head.
pros: Separate variable-speed dial makes it easier to get the best cuts while fully pressing the trigger
5.5-inch cutting radius is smaller than other options for sharper turns
cons: Struggles with cutting curves and corners on metal thicker than 18-gauge steel

customer_reviews.title: Blades ground incorrectly
customer_reviews.text: The tool was a little difficult to position on a flat piece of mild 22 gauge mild steel. If I positioned just right it cut very well. Upon inspection I found that one of the blades was not ground correctly which caused the tool not to sit flat. I called DeWalt support and they confirmed the blade was not ground correctly. I’m returning the tool and Amazon is replacing, the only issue is a 3 week lead time, hopefully it will improve and I’ll give an update, maybe 4 or 5 stars next time
customer_reviews.author: Eng40

customer_reviews.title: Makes sheet metal easier
customer_reviews.text: Im a hvac service tech and will do an occasional install. These work great on the metal of the furnace for the return. Works good for sheetmetal as well. Good control and speed. My only minor complaint is that the opening of the sheer, i wish was.a little bit larger to help get it started.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: DW890 Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool a lot! I like that the Dewalt has a trigger that can be locked on allowing the tool to be held in different ways. The very similar 'Kett' tool does not have a trigger lock. I wish that the cord came out of the top of the motor, keeping it away from the cut metal. (Are you listening Dewalt?)
customer_reviews.author: Paul Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Slow an Easy and it works great.
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little practice and if you get in hurry, it is real difficult to make a straight cut. But take your time and keep the speed down to allow great control on level and non-level metal (such as the ribs in metal roofing). These have been a real life saver and leave a curl of metal with only a very slight rough edge. Much better than tin snips.
customer_reviews.author: Roy A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality tool.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great but only up to 18 gauge. If your material is any thicker these will simply not engage on the piece. I ended up returning for a larger gauge tool but that was not the fault of the tool. Just my failure to carefully read the specs.
customer_reviews.author: Greg V.

customer_reviews.title: Good Sheet Metal Cutter
customer_reviews.text: Nice variable speed drive allows for finessing around corners. It's remarkable how smoothly this shear slices through sheet metal at low speed once you get the angle just right. Don't expect it to cut through anything thick like the four layer joint of a spiral wound duct section unless the total thickness is the equivalent of 18 gauge or less.
customer_reviews.author: JMW

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: very dependable and strong cuts up to 18 gage material
customer_reviews.author: Nip

customer_reviews.title: Best tool in my shed!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is awesome!!! Love how they just cut through metal roofing sheets effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Great!! Works well! once you get the hang of how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Angela & Robert Henry

customer_reviews.title: Not your satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: Not satisfied with this tool at all. It does not articulate well on any contour metal. I can do a better job with a hand shear and in less time. I am very dissatisfied. A very expensive tool that you cannot use unless you have smooth metal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good product, cuts through galvanized flashing very easily once you get it at the proper angle.
customer_reviews.author: Oklahoma Reader

customer_reviews.title: Drill attachment works much better.
customer_reviews.text: Not ideal for metal roofing. Drill attachment works much better.
customer_reviews.author: michael presley

customer_reviews.title: exellent tool
customer_reviews.text: easy to use right outta the box, just plug it in and away you go, cuts clean and accurately, sure beats cutting sheet metal by hand with my old manual shears. Dewalt you did good
customer_reviews.author: william saunders

customer_reviews.title: Great shear
customer_reviews.text: Great shear. Must have for rip cuts on metal roofing/ metal wall panels.
customer_reviews.author: Idigdirt

customer_reviews.title: Came in excellent time.
customer_reviews.text: As described. Cut the guys time, at least, in half. Came in excellent time.
customer_reviews.author: luvagoodby

customer_reviews.title: Great little cutting tool for flat sheet metal
customer_reviews.text: Great little cutting tool for flat sheet metal, straight cuts or turns. Needs help with hand shears on bends, or angles.
customer_reviews.author: GezaWdeC

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: This does the job without a problem. Easy to use. With a one minute lesson, a beginner can go. made in Mexico
customer_reviews.author: ginny

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Saves me lots of time. No more cutting with a normal shear or cutting with an angle grinder
customer_reviews.author: Rudolph Ramdass

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: these are super shears they work well and fit your hand very nice. more than enough power to do and job.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool
customer_reviews.text: Definitely better than a pair of handheld shears, there's no comparison there. But there is a bit of a learning curve in how to tilt the tool optimally so it advances through the metal stock easily. Tends to mar to the sides of what you are cutting, if that is a concern or not.Overall, I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through mesh hardware cloth like butter!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this swivel head shear! It made cutting through hardware cloth soooooooo much easier! We'd been using hand held snips and had blisters and it took forever. Using this shear cut the time down so dramatically! LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.author: RMAC

customer_reviews.title: Mariginally good.
customer_reviews.text: Takes very small bites. Works best on thin material only. Thicker material bogs it down. Does not turn easily. But, for the price, it does the job. There are better one's out there that costs more.
customer_reviews.author: Unanimouse

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to put tin siding up it works great but if you have ribs like I did it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to put tin siding up it works great but if you have ribs like I did it is a little harder to use make sure you get one with a longer blade. It was still able to cut through it just a lot harder.
customer_reviews.author: Stew

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to do an FRP panel installation job. It worked great.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Hamel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: tough I use a bit of WD on the metal .
customer_reviews.author: coalbinbob

customer_reviews.title: good tool
customer_reviews.text: wanted one of these for years , wont use them a lot , but will come in handy when needed
customer_reviews.author: donna f gnemi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tool shreds through sheetmetal like the hottest of knives through butter!
customer_reviews.author: Blake Stiller

customer_reviews.title: happy
customer_reviews.text: Works well with the steel, but across the corrugated part not so well, maybe its the guy who's running the shears. Seems to be built well. Im glad I got it. Moeller from Nebr.
customer_reviews.author: B. Moeller

product_meta.title: DEWALT Metal Shear, Swivel Head, 18GA (DW890),Yellow
product_meta.description:
Variable speed dial, all ball-bearing motor for long life, head swivels 360 degrees, cuts 7/32" strip which continuously curls out of cutting area for clear line of sight, cuts radius of 5-1/2" and larger. Specs: Max watts out 470W, strokes/Min 0-2, 500 SPM, capacity in: (mild steel) 18 gauge (stainless steel) 20 gauge, replacement parts: left/right blade, center blade, 9.1&Quot; long, weighs 5.0 lbs.

AMAZON.COM
Cutting through metal is a simple process if you have the right tool. Quickly slice your way through sheets of metal with the innovative DEWALT DW890 18 gauge electric shear with pivoting head. Powerful and easy to operate, the DW890 features a hearty 5 amp, all ball-bearing motor for enduring nonstop use and multiple speeds so you can adjust your tool for various metal widths. For increased precision, this shear also features a 360 degree pivoting head and operates without losing sight of the cutting line. For best results, use the DW890 with a maximum 18 gauge for low carbon steel and 20 gauge for stainless steel.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The DW890 18-gauge swivel head and shear provide extraordinary power and versatility, cutting sheet metal with a scissors-like action quickly, accurately, and easily while providing good visibility to the cutting line. These shears feature high-output motors for long life in continuous-duty applications. Users can rotate the unit's 360-degree swivel head for optimum cutting convenience while the variable speed facilitates adjustments to thickness of metal the user is cutting. The DW890 is ideal for mild steel of 18 gauge and thinner and stainless steel of 20 gauge and thinner. 

 Features


 * Powerful 5 amp, all-ball-bearing motor for long life 
 * Head swivels 360 degrees for cutting convenience 
 * Cuts 7/32-inch strip, which continuously curls out of cutting area for clear line of sight 
 * Variable speed permits cutting metals of a wide variety of thickness 
 * Cuts radius of 5-1/2 inches and larger 

 Specifications


 * Amps: 5 amps 
 * Max. watts out: 470 watts 
 * Strokes per minute: 0 to 2,500 spm 
 * Capacity (mild steel): 18 gauge 
 * Capacity (stainless steel): 20 gauge 
 * Tool length: 9.125 inches 
 * Tool weight: 5 lbs. 

 Warranty
This DeWalt high-performance industrial tool comes with a warranty package that includes:
30-day, no-risk satisfaction guarantee
One-year free service contract
One-year warranty

See more
feature_bullets: The product is easy to use
Head swivels 360 degree for cutting convenience
Cuts 7/32-inch strip which continuously curls out of cutting area for clear line of sight
Variable speed dial allows user to vary speed for specific materials and various applications (100-350 spm)
Powerful, 5.0 Amp, all ball-bearing motor for long life
